newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Brazil real ends off 0.05 pct on lower mini-band.
newsitem.headline: Brazil real ends off 0.05 pct on lower mini-band.

text.p: Brazil's real closed at 1.0171 per dollar down 0.05 percent in the commercial foreign exchange market after the Central Bank set a weaker mini-band for the currency of 1.017 to 1.022 per dollar, dealers said.
The Central Bank set the new real-dollar mini-band in a late afternoon auction. The previous mini-band, set on August 29, was between 1.016 and 1.021 reais to the dollar.
Earlier on Thursday, the real reached 1.0177 per greenback, pressured by dollar outflows, dealers said.

In the late afternoon, preliminary figures for commercial and financial foreign exchange contracts showed a Thursday deficit of around $220 million, mostly due to financial sell operations, dealers said.
In the interbank floating rate market, the real dropped 0.02 percent to end at 1.0214 to the dollar.
In the illegal parallel market, the real closed at 1.028 per greenback, down 0.1 percent, traders said.
